meanings.definition: A protein that stores iron in the body.
meanings.sent1: The ferritin in our bodies helps store iron for when we need it.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can check your iron levels by measuring ferritin in your blood.
meanings.sent3: I imagine ferritin as a tiny iron warehouse inside us, always ready to supply when needed.
meanings.sent4: Her body's ferritin acted like a reliable iron safe, keeping the precious mineral secure.
meanings.sent5: The ferritin protein is like a vigilant guardian, safeguarding the iron reserves.

meanings.definition: A biomarker used to measure iron levels in the blood.
meanings.sent1: When the doctor checked my ferritin, they could tell how much iron I had.
meanings.sent2: Low ferritin levels may indicate an iron deficiency in the body.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my ferritin was the blood's iron speedometer, showing how fast I was running out of iron.
meanings.sent4: Her ferritin reading was like a compass pointing to the iron levels in her blood.
meanings.sent5: The ferritin biomarker is a helpful guide, revealing the iron status in our bloodstream.
